arts.ttl: Leicester City should keep touting their stars' Champions League potential as transfer blueprint - Jordan Blackwell - Leicestershire Live
arts.sum: No matter what happens with City on the pitch, and whether El Khannouss leaves this summer or next or even in two years’ time, it feels the superstar potential he’s shown will ensure the club make a significant profit on him. Players like Boubakary Soumare, who is finally showing signs of reaching his potential now, and Patson Daka were similar ages and had similar pedigrees to El Khannouss when they signed for City, and they don’t look like leaving for significant profits.

arts.ttl: Ruud van Nistelrooy breaks unwanted Premier League record as Leicester crisis deepens
arts.sum: Leicester City were thrashed 4-0 at home by Brentford on Friday night in a match which saw them hit a new low in the Premier League under manager Ruud van Nistelrooy

arts.ttl: Ruud van Nistelrooy delivers brutal verdict of Leicester City squad amid 'alarming' situation
arts.sum: Leicester City have a “huge mountain to climb” because every week they face a better team, manager Ruud van Nistelrooy admitted in a brutal verdict of his own squad. “We have to accept that we are in a position where every week we face a better team,” van Nistelrooy said.

arts.ttl: 'Huge mountain to climb' - Leicester in 'alarming situation'
arts.sum: Protests. No home league goal in over two months. Rooted in the relegation zone. What next for Leicester?

arts.ttl: FPL notes: Mbeumo haul, “magician” Damsgaard + awful Leicester
arts.sum: Key notes, quotes and stats from Leicester 0-4 Brentford The post FPL notes: Mbeumo haul, “magician” Damsgaard + awful Leicester appeared first on Best FPL Tips, Advice, Team News, Picks, and Statistics from Fantasy Football Scout.

arts.ttl: Ruud van Nistelrooy says Leicester face ‘huge mountain’ to avoid relegation
arts.sum: Brentford moved into the top half of the Premier League with a 4-0 win.

arts.ttl: Leicester 0-4 Brentford: Bees inflict latest damaging defeat on Foxes with clinical first-half
arts.sum: Bees raced into a three-goal lead at half-time before easing to a comfortable victory

arts.ttl: Brentford hit FOUR to heap more misery on Ruud's Leicester
arts.sum: FREE TO WATCH: Highlights from Leicester City’s match against Brentford in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Furious Leicester fans send message as Ruud van Nistelrooy's side produce sorry Brentford show
arts.sum: LEICESTER CITY 0-4 BRENTFORD: Ruud van Nistelrooy could only watch on from the sidelines as his team failed to turn up and allowed a rampant Bees side to run riot

arts.ttl: Leicester City player ratings v Brentford as defending shambolic in record-setting defeat - Jordan Blackwell - Leicestershire Live
arts.sum: Brentford capitalised on City’s panicked, unorganised defending to score through Yoane Wissa, Bryan Mbeumo and Christian Norgaard, and City at no point looked like they could fight back. Vardy was again denied by Flekken as City looked for an instant response, but Brentford quickly reasserted their dominance.
